comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: "Marshal Joseph Jacques Césaire Joffre, G.C.B., O.M. (French pronunciation: ​[ʒɔsɛf ʒɔfʁ]; 12 January 1852 – 3 January 1931), was a French general during World War I. He is most known for regrouping the retreating allied armies to defeat the Germans at the strategically decisive First Battle of the Marne in 1914. His popularity led to his nickname Papa Joffre." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joffre There are many Bain photos of Joffre, commander in chief of the French Army. www.flickr.com/search/?w=8623220@N02&q=joffre "Field Marshal Horatio Herbert Kitchener, 1st Earl Kitchener, KG, KP, GCB, OM, GCSI, GCMG, GCIE, ADC, PC (24 June 1850 – 5 June 1916) was a British Field Marshal and proconsul who won fame for his imperial campaigns and later played a central role in the early part of the First World War, although he died halfway through it." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herbert_Kitchener,_1st_Earl_Kitchener Other Bain photos of Herbert Kitchener: www.flickr.com/search/?w=8623220@N02&q=herbert%20kitc...

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: artolog:  Thanks again for another full name which we can include next time we update!

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This was almost certainly taken outside the War Office in London on the occasion of Joffre's previously unpublicized visit with Kitchener on October 29, 1915. According to this account, they left the building at 1:30 p.m. that day together. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30615F6355A1573... Old War Office building entrance, street view: maps.google.com/maps?q=map+whitehall,+london&ll=51.50...
